question: Are Crocus sativus compounds being considered against Alzheimer's disease?
ideal_answer: Yes, it has been observed that Crocus sativus extracts and compounds have a positive effect against Alzheimer's disease.

snippets.text: Previous evidence suggested that Crocus sativus is linked to improving cognitive function in Alzheimer's disease (AD) patients. The aim of this study was to in vitro and in vivo investigate the mechanism(s) by which Crocus sativus exerts its positive effect against AD.
Collectively, findings from this study support the positive effect of Crocus sativus against AD by reducing Aβ pathological manifestations.
